file_content.text: Hoth's a little warmer thanks to you.
Did you find the holocron?
That's wonder... won... blast! I'd kill for a good sneeze, but I'll be free of this planet soon enough.
The Dark Council will hear of your hand in the holocron's recovery. Here, a token of my gratitude, something to take your mind off the cold.
You'd think the Sith could've found a more hospitable place to hide the holocron.
Captain Kanen, at your service.
I'd shake your hand, but I'm sick as a dog. The cold may freeze mucus, but it sure doesn't kill germs.
Yes, Hoth's a lovely planet. I gave fourteen years to the Empire for the honor of salvaging Sith artifacts off an icy wasteland.
I'm glad you value your post, Captain. Otherwise, I'd be forced to remove you.
Watch your tone.
Yes, my lord. It's a dream come true.
What dark relics are you after? What power do they hold? Tell me.
Sith artifacts, you said?
I--I know little, my lord. Only that we're searching for a specific piece.
Your men look to you as a role model, Captain. Set an example worthy of your rank.
Stop complaining.
Sorry, sir. You're right. Besides, I have my duties to attend to.
You Imps are soft. Spend more time outside the office, and the cold wouldn't bother you so much.
Hoth's not that bad.
A rugged lifestyle fits some more than others, hunter. I only hope my time on Hoth is short.
What artifacts?
No right-minded Imperial would dare attempt sarcasm on me.
I don't appreciate your tone.
I'm sorry, my lord. This illness, I'm not... I meant no disrespect.
You sound feverish, Captain.
I'll survive, thank you. My duty doesn't exactly afford recovery time.
You shouldn't gripe to me.
I didn't, I mean you're healthy, you survived the ship graveyard. Maybe my task would interest you.
I'm overseeing a mission for the Dark Council. A noble endeavor, I'm assured.
Decades ago, a Sith holocron was believed destroyed in the battle over Hoth. Our Chiss cohorts recently traded us intel suggesting otherwise.
What's become of the holocron?
Where is it now?
Are you sure our blue-skinned friends aren't steering us wrong?
Can we trust the Chiss?
I know our Expansionary Defense Force. They won't deal in bad intel.
We can trust the Chiss.
Regardless, we analyzed their findings. Everything checked out.
I trust we've verified the Chiss' claim?
And the intel checks out?
Their findings hold up, all right.
Why worry about a holocron?
Holocrons hold valuable information. If this contains records from the battle over Hoth, it may prove priceless.
We've, ugh, excuse me. We've tracked the holocron to a cave. It's brimming over with, uh... white fur, gristle-dripping fangs... ah, wampas.
My recovery teams just provide the beasts with a warm meal. But you... you could retrieve the holocron.
The holocron will be ours.
Thank you. It's been frozen too long.
I can, but it'll cost you.
You'd extort a sick man, hunter? What am I saying? Of course I'll pay.
Maybe, Captain. Maybe.
Good. I'd rather not send another team to their deaths.
The holocron's deep beneath the surface, frozen in the grip of the Sith who hid it there. Pry it from his hand, and watch out for those wampas.
But I won't. [Refuse quest]
Well, thank you for the equipment anyway.
Captain Kanen. I recovered these supplies from the ship graveyard. I've been told you need them.
Finally. Been weeks without working equipment. Now if we could only get a decent meal.
I think my sinuses are frozen.
